intro: Ricinodendron heudelotii subsp. heudelotii, commonly known as the African shea tree, is a large deciduous tree native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and palmately lobed leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody fruits containing oily seeds. The seeds are the primary source of shea butter, a valuable natural product used in cosmetics and cooking. It plays an important ecological and economic role in its native regions.
